data.description: What we’re looking for: Grad Dates: December 2026 & May 2027 grads Location: South Florida Offices (Port of Miami, Downtown Tech Hub, Miramar Tech Hub, Entertainment Studios) Format: Hybrid: In-person Monday - Thursday and remote on Fridays Dates: June 1st - August 7th 2026 Work Authorization: Permanent US Work Authorization required Journey with us! Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our exciting team of employees. Royal Caribbean Group is pleased to offer competitive compensation and excellent career development opportunities, offering unique ways to explore your career. Royal Caribbean Group’s Revenue Team has an exciting internship opportunity within the team, see below. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and it’s in the applicant's best interest to apply early. About the Program: The Royal Caribbean Group 10-week internship program is designed to cultivate future leaders by providing meaningful work experiences within various departments in the organization. Interns will work alongside industry professionals to develop their skills and understanding of the cruise and travel industry. The program offers students the opportunity to gain real-world experience in a dynamic and collaborative environment, contributing to projects that impact millions of vacationers worldwide. During our award-winning program, our interns will experience professional development sessions, community service opportunities, executive spotlights, behind the scenes ship tours and more! Join us and set sail on an unforgettable journey of growth, discovery, and career advancement with Royal Caribbean Group! About the Department: The Global Enterprise Technology Department is the central nervous system of technology at the company. It encompasses Global IT strategy and operations, cybersecurity and data privacy, enterprise applications and systems integration, and IT governance. The team develops and maintains software solutions, manages key technology projects, and ensures secure, reliable IT systems organization-wide to enable seamless operations. 2026 Internship Positions in Global Enterprise Technology: Data Engineering Infrastructure & Operations Enterprise Products IT Product Engineering Shipboard Products Data Analytics & AI IT Project Management Revenue Planning Safety & Marine Standards Qualifications: Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, IT, or related field of study with expected graduation date of December 2026 or May 2027 Must have authorization to work in the U.S. on a permanent and ongoing basis Minimum GPA of 3.2 is highly preferred Previous experience in related areas We know there's a lot to consider. As you go through the application process, our recruiters will be glad to provide guidance, and more relevant details to answer any additional questions. Thank you again for your interest in Royal Caribbean Group. We hope to see you onboard soon! It is the policy of the Company to ensure equal employment and promotion opportunity to qualified candidates without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, sexuality, gender identity or expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal Caribbean Group and each of its subsidiaries prohibit and will not tolerate discrimination or harassment.
